The movie tells the story of George Bailey (played by James Stewart) who has lost his way in life due to the combined influence of an overly optimistic Mr. Potter (played by Henry Fonda)) and a relentlessly vindictive county auditor named Walter Mank (played by Orson Welles)). The movie also features memorable scenes, such as the climactic scene in which George Bailey decides to take responsibility for his own life instead of allowing himself to be dominated by others.
